page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY STANFORD 1
page.content: Most of the farms still belong to Sir Francis Winnington, of Brockhill Estate. The Winnington family lived at Stanford Court from 1673. Death duties forced them to sell Stanford Court in the 1940s, and the house and stables are now used as a sawmilling business. The family run tenanted farms are protected by the new Succession Law. A lake covering 60 acres lies by the side of Stanford Court and a fishing syndicate have the rights to stock and fish the lake for trout. There are many hardwood trees around the lake. The side of the valley, called Stoney Head is forestry managed by Brockhill Estate. The Church stands on the side of the valley just below the forests.
